alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Licking; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN, DELAWARE, NORTHWESTERN LICKING AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New California, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Delaware, Hilliard, Marysville, Worthington, Powell, Sunbury, Ashley, New California, Polaris, Radnor, Shawnee Hills, Galena, Ostrander, Hartford, Alum Creek State Park, Delaware State Park and Olive Green. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
